keyword: how many calories in a breast of fried chicken
title: How Many Calories in a Breast of Fried Chicken?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a breast of fried chicken, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better choices.
h1: How Many Calories in a Breast of Fried Chicken?
assumptions: Bone-in, skin-on chicken breast, breaded and deep-fried in oil; standard fast-food portion (~200g edible meat).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, breading thickness, oil type, frying method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One fried chicken breast contains about 450 kcal and 40 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 450 kcal for one standard breaded and fried breast.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a breast of fried chicken?
faqs.a: About 40 g protein per breast, making it a good source despite the frying.

faqs.q: Does fried chicken breast have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 25 g total fat, including 6 g saturated, mostly from oil and skin.

faqs.q: How does baking change calories in fried chicken?
faqs.a: Baked versions can reduce calories by 100-200 kcal by avoiding absorbed oil.

faqs.q: Is sodium high in a breast of fried chicken?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 800 mg due to seasoning and breading; watch for high blood pressure.
